ygData.subject: Some performance numbers
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, In case anyone is interested there is an update to my FastRandom random number generator code over at: http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/fastrandom.asp

Hi all, In case anyone is interested there is an update to my FastRandom 
random number generator code over at:

http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/fastrandom.asp

It's mainly just for a bug fix and also performance tweaks to the 
NextBytes() routine none of which affects SharpNEAT if memory serves. 
However I have updated the performance tests table using my new beefed 
up PC and also the .Net 2.0 runtime engine. I was pleasantly surprised 
to see a significant performance improvement under .Net 2.0 independent 
of the new hardware.

If we take the NextDouble() routine - which is the one most heavily used 
- running on .Net 2.0 on the new hardware the performance is now 185m 
calls/sec on one core, so lets say roughly 370m calls/sec overall. This 
compares to just 87m*2=174m for System.Random (the built in random 
number generator class). The old figures for an Athlon 2400+ on .Net 1.1 
are 87m and 50m calls/sec.

Overall improvement in performance then, taking into account all 
factors, has gone from 50m to 370m calls/sec or 7.4x faster. Which is 
fairly impressive.

I should point out that the new hardware is an Intel Core 2 Duo E660 
2.4Ghz overclocked to 3.11Ghz. Despite overclocking the CPU temp is 
fairly low at about 48C and overall PC power consumption is about 120W 
at 100% CPU (both cores). And finally SiSoft Sandra reports 
28,888MIPS/19,654MFlops versus 6,603MIPS/3357MFlops for my old workhorse 
Athlon 2800 shuttle PC, so overall a pretty handy little system if 
you're looking for more CPU power for your NEAT experiments.

Colin.
